page.title: 07HEALTH + EDUCATION SERVICES
page.content: OTHER MEDICAL SERVICES,DOCTORS AND DENTISTS HAVE TO BE JOURNEYED TO EITHER IN RETFORD OR THE OTHER NEARBY TOWNS. DISTRICT NURSES AND HEALTH VISITORS PAY THE CUSTOMARY VISITS ON THE RESIDENTS. CHILDREN IN THE GRID ATTENDING STATE SCHOOLS DO SO IN EITHER NORTH WHEATLEY OR IN THE CASE OF HAYTON AT CLARBOROUGH.THEY LEAVE THE RESPECTIVE SCHOOLS AT ELEVEN AND ATTEND SECONDARY SCHOOL IN RETFORD. THIS HAS A LIMITING EFFECT ON THE WAYS THE CHILDREN CAN SPEND THEIR TIME. THE CHILDREN HAVE TO BE BUSSED TO AND FROM THE SCHOOLS AND THE OUT OF SCHOOL ACTIVITIES THEY CAN ATTEND DEPEND ON THE ABILITY OF THEIR PARENTS TO TRANSPORT THEM TO AND FROM THEIR HOMES.
